controls.title: Policies for information security
controls.description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

controls.title: Information security roles and responsibilities
controls.description: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated according to the organization needs.

controls.title: Segregation of duties
controls.description: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be segregated to reduce opportunities for unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse of the organization's assets.

controls.title: Management responsibilities
controls.description: Management shall require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies, and procedures of the organization.

controls.title: Contact with authorities
controls.description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities.

controls.title: Contact with special interest groups
controls.description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.

controls.title: Threat intelligence
controls.description: Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.

controls.title: Information security in project management
controls.description: Information security shall be integrated into project management regardless of the type of project.

controls.title: Inventory of information and other associated assets
controls.description: An inventory of information and other associated assets, including owners, shall be developed and maintained.

controls.title: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
controls.description: Rules for the acceptable use of information and other associated assets and for the handling of information and other associated assets shall be identified, documented, and implemented.

controls.title: Return of assets
controls.description: Personnel and other interested parties as appropriate shall return all the organization's assets in their possession upon change or termination of their employment, contract, or agreement.

controls.title: Classification of information
controls.description: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability, and relevant interested party requirements.

controls.title: Labelling of information
controls.description: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organization.

controls.title: Information transfer
controls.description: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements shall be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organization and between the organization and other parties.

controls.title: Access control
controls.description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.

controls.title: Identity management
controls.description: The full life cycle of identities shall be managed.

controls.title: Authentication information
controls.description: Allocation and management of authentication information shall be controlled by a management process including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information.

controls.title: Access rights
controls.description: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall be provisioned, reviewed, modified, and removed in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.

controls.title: Information security in supplier relationships
controls.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.

controls.title: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
controls.description: Relevant information security requirements shall be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.

controls.title: Managing information security in the ICT supply chain
controls.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.

controls.title: Monitoring, review, and change management of supplier services
controls.description: The organization shall regularly monitor, review, evaluate, and manage change in supplier information security practices and service delivery.

controls.title: Information security for use of cloud services
controls.description: Processes for acquisition, use, management, and exit from cloud services shall be established in accordance with the organization's information security requirements.

controls.title: Information security incident management planning and preparation
controls.description: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing, and communicating information security incident management processes, roles, and responsibilities.

controls.title: Assessment and decision on information security events
controls.description: The organization shall assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorized as information security incidents.

controls.title: Response to information security incidents
controls.description: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.

controls.title: Learning from information security incidents
controls.description: Knowledge gained from information security incidents shall be used to strengthen and improve the information security controls.

controls.title: Collection of evidence
controls.description: The organization shall establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition, and preservation of evidence related to information security events.

controls.title: Information security during disruption
controls.description: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.

controls.title: ICT readiness for business continuity
controls.description: ICT readiness shall be planned, implemented, maintained, and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.

controls.title: Legal, statutory, regulatory, and contractual requirements
controls.description: Legal, statutory, regulatory, and contractual requirements relevant to information security and the organization's approach to meet these requirements shall be identified, documented, and kept up to date.

controls.title: Intellectual property rights
controls.description: The organization shall implement appropriate procedures to protect intellectual property rights.

controls.title: Protection of records
controls.description: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access, and unauthorized release.

controls.title: Privacy and protection of personal identifiable information (PII)
controls.description: The organization shall identify and meet the requirements regarding the preservation of privacy and protection of PII as applicable, according to relevant laws, regulations, and contractual requirements.

controls.title: Independent review of information security
controls.description: The organization's approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes, and technologies shall be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur.

controls.title: Compliance with policies, rules, and standards for information security
controls.description: Compliance with the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules, and standards shall be regularly reviewed.

controls.title: Documented operating procedures
controls.description: Operating procedures for information processing facilities shall be documented and made available to personnel who need them.

controls.title: Screening
controls.description: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel shall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis taking into account applicable laws, regulations, and ethics and be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed, and the perceived risks.

controls.title: Terms and conditions of employment
controls.description: The employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel's and the organization's responsibilities for information security.

controls.title: Information security awareness, education, and training
controls.description: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness, education, and training and regular updates of the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies, and procedures, as relevant for their job function.

controls.title: Disciplinary process
controls.description: A disciplinary process shall be formalized and communicated to take actions against personnel and other relevant interested parties who have committed an information security policy violation.

controls.title: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
controls.description: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, enforced, and communicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties.

controls.title: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
controls.description: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization's needs for the protection of information shall be identified, documented, regularly reviewed, and signed by personnel and other relevant interested parties.

controls.title: Remote working
controls.description: Security measures shall be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed, or stored outside the organization's premises.

controls.title: Information security event reporting
controls.description: The organization shall provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.

controls.title: Physical security perimeters
controls.description: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets.

controls.title: Physical entry
controls.description: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls and access points.

controls.title: Securing offices, rooms, and facilities
controls.description: Physical security for offices, rooms, and facilities shall be designed and implemented.

controls.title: Physical security monitoring
controls.description: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.

controls.title: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
controls.description: Protection against physical and environmental threats, such as natural disasters and other intentional or unintentional physical threats to infrastructure, shall be designed and implemented.

controls.title: Working in secure areas
controls.description: Security measures for working in secure areas shall be designed and implemented.

controls.title: Clear desk and clear screen
controls.description: Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clear screen rules for information processing facilities shall be defined and appropriately enforced.

controls.title: Equipment siting and protection
controls.description: Equipment shall be sited securely and protected.

controls.title: Security of assets off-premises
controls.description: Off-site assets shall be protected.

controls.title: Storage media
controls.description: Storage media shall be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation, and disposal in accordance with the organization's classification scheme and handling requirements.

controls.title: Supporting utilities
controls.description: Information processing facilities shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.

controls.title: Cabling security
controls.description: Cables carrying power, data, or supporting information services shall be protected from interception, interference, or damage.

controls.title: Equipment maintenance
controls.description: Equipment shall be maintained correctly to ensure availability, integrity, and continued confidentiality of information.

controls.title: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
controls.description: Items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.

controls.title: User endpoint devices
controls.description: Information stored on, processed by, or accessible via user endpoint devices shall be protected.

controls.title: Privileged access rights
controls.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.

controls.title: Information access restriction
controls.description: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.

controls.title: Access to source code
controls.description: Read and write access to source code, development tools, and software libraries shall be appropriately managed.

controls.title: Secure authentication
controls.description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be established and implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.

controls.title: Capacity management
controls.description: The use of resources shall be monitored and adjusted in line with current and expected capacity requirements.

controls.title: Protection against malware
controls.description: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.

controls.title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
controls.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated, and appropriate measures shall be taken.

controls.title: Configuration management
controls.description: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services, and networks shall be established, documented, implemented, monitored, and reviewed.

controls.title: Information deletion
controls.description: Information stored in information systems, devices, or in any other storage media shall be deleted when no longer required.

controls.title: Data masking
controls.description: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.

controls.title: Data leakage prevention
controls.description: Data leakage prevention measures shall be applied to systems, networks, and any other devices that process, store, or transmit sensitive information.

controls.title: Information backup
controls.description: Backup copies of information, software, and systems shall be maintained and regularly tested in accordance with the agreed topic-specific policy on backup.

controls.title: Redundancy of information processing facilities
controls.description: Information processing facilities shall be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability requirements.

controls.title: Logging
controls.description: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults, and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected, and analysed.

controls.title: Monitoring activities
controls.description: Networks, systems, and applications shall be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential information security incidents.

controls.title: Clock synchronization
controls.description: The clocks of information processing systems used by the organization shall be synchronized to approved time sources.

controls.title: Use of privileged utility programs
controls.description: The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.

controls.title: Installation of software on operational systems
controls.description: Procedures and measures shall be implemented to securely manage software installation on operational systems.

controls.title: Networks security
controls.description: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed, and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.

controls.title: Security of network services
controls.description: Security mechanisms, service levels, and service requirements of network services shall be identified, implemented, and monitored.

controls.title: Segregation of networks
controls.description: Groups of information services, users, and information systems shall be segregated in the organization's networks.

controls.title: Web filtering
controls.description: Access to external websites shall be managed to reduce exposure to malicious content.

controls.title: Use of cryptography
controls.description: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.

controls.title: Secure development life cycle
controls.description: Rules for the secure development of software and systems shall be established and applied.

controls.title: Application security requirements
controls.description: Information security requirements shall be identified, specified, and approved when developing or acquiring applications.

controls.title: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
controls.description: Principles for engineering secure systems shall be established, documented, maintained, and applied to any information system development activity.

controls.title: Secure coding
controls.description: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.

controls.title: Security testing in development and acceptance
controls.description: Security testing processes shall be defined and implemented in the development life cycle.

controls.title: Outsourced development
controls.description: The organization shall direct, monitor, and review the activities related to outsourced system development.

controls.title: Separation of development, test, and production environments
controls.description: Development, testing, and production environments shall be separated and secured.

controls.title: Change management
controls.description: Changes to information processing facilities and information systems shall be subject to change management procedures.

controls.title: Test information
controls.description: Test information shall be appropriately selected, protected, and managed.

controls.title: Protection of information systems during audit testing
controls.description: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of operational systems shall be planned and agreed between the tester and appropriate management.
